page.title: 09FLOATING NIGHTCLUB,GATESHEAD
page.content: The "Tuxedo Princess" is a{floating {nightclub and discotheque.}It is moored at Gateshead quayside beneath the world famous landmark of the{Tyne {Bridge.}The ship was originally a Glasgow built car ferry which took holiday-makers to Ireland and later to the Channel Isles. The "Princess" can accomodate 1400 people and has proved to be so popular that parties come to it from{Scotland}and{Yorkshire.} Because it is 'out of the ordinary' families go there for their celebrations.We were surprised to see that the staff are dressed like a ship's crew and we were assured that the vessel is seaworthy. The fame of the "Princess" is spreading. A similar nightclub may be opened on the{Thames and the{Chinese government}have asked the owners for advice on a similar venture.
